Name: Grand Sidecar
Ingredients: 60 ml Grand Marnier or other cognac orange liqueur
15 ml Chilled water omit if using wet ice
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
RIM glass with sugar (moisten the outside edge with orange juice and dip into sugar).
Prepare garnish of orange zest twist.
EXPRESS orange zest twist over the cocktail and use as garnish.
Review: A riff on the classic Sidecar that's even simpler to make but equally tasty. Grand Marnier Cordon Rouge consists of 51% cognac so there is no need to add cognac to make a great Sidecar, simply add lemon juice. This drink benefits from a touch of dilution so also works well served on-the-rocks in an old-fashioned glass.
History: Created in June 2005 by yours truly, London, England. See: Sidecar history
Nutrition: One serving of Grand Sidecar contains 154 calories
